Entries.TTSP.ManifestInteract: The manifest does not react to your presence.
Entries.Farmhouse.JasHay: A decorative hay bale, for memory's sake.
Entries.Farmhouse.JasTrinket: An antique clock and a little golden trinket box. You're still not quite sure what this is or why it means so much to her.
Entries.Farmhouse.LeoPerch: No bird is ever going to land in here, but that isn't really the point of it.
Entries.Farmhouse.LeoHut: Seems like Leo enjoys getting cozy in here from time to time.
Entries.Farmhouse.VinceBox: Vincent's old toybox. It seems nowadays he just uses it for miscellaneous storage.#Lying at the bottom, though, there remains an old, dirty jump-rope, pieces of splintered wood, and... hair?#This box could use a good cleaning.
Entries.Farmhouse.VinceTrash: Vincent's aim could use some work.
Entries.Farmhouse.VinceConsole: An old video game console. Seldom used, but thoroughly enjoyed.
Entries.Farmhouse.VinceGlobe: A nice globe, though it's been marked all over with red dots, presumably as locations to visit.

Entries.Farmhouse.JasBook: An unfinished book. The cover reads 'Mouse of Greaves', with the back cover describing it as a story about a rodent knight fighting against evil humans. It's quite hefty.

An unfinished book. The cover reads 'Then-There Nun', with the back cover describing it as a story about a time-traveling, teleporting nun's attempts to save the life of a man named 'Jesus Christ'. Apparently, this one went through several name changes.

An unfinished book. The cover reads 'The Fame of This Rook is Sacred', with the back cover describing it as a story about an anthropomorphic chess piece becoming a religious icon. For some reason, the back cover is printed backwards.

An unfinished book. The cover reads 'An Emory of Mirth', with the back cover describing it as a story about a man named Arson Emory spreading cheer (and destruction) through all the lands. For some reason, there's no author listed.

An unfinished book. The cover reads 'Late Expirations', with the back cover describing it as a story about a man who discovers a way to prevent food from ever spoiling... and then sells the technology at a premium. It's a bit wordy.

An unfinished book. The cover reads 'Tyrannosaurus Rex', with the back cover describing it as a story about a fearsome dinosaur king cursed by prophecy to one day kill his father and... oh, oh no. No need to read that.

An unfinished book. The cover reads 'Doves, Rice, and Ken', with the back cover describing it as a story about a man named Ken Clarkson attempting to bring his doves and his rice across a river, but he cannot bring both at the same time or else the doves will eat the rice.
